prj:ObsProject.prj:projectName: The Coldest Object in the Universe: Probing the Mass Distribution of the Ultra-Cold Outflow and Dusty Disk in the Boomerang Nebula
prj:ObsProject.prj:staffProjectNote:
2013-07-15, Richard Simon - version 5 File: 2012.1.00501.S_v5.aot - Incremented version number to 5 - Added two "Do Not Observe" SBs to the empty Member OUSs to work around error if empty Member OUSs are in the project. - {color:red}*NOTE:*{color} The two "Do Not Observe" SBs will need to be replaced with the needed TP SBs, once final TP procedures are available.
2013-02-27, Richard Simon - version 4 - Incremented version number to 4 (v3 was work in progress) - Regenerated SBs using RC6 to get around OT bug in the band pass cal queries. - Deleted TP SBs (Boomerang_115_TP_Cal and Boomerang_115_TP_Science) pending updated procedures from the JAO. {color:red}*The TP SBs will need to be generated when final procedures are available*{color} - Following discussion with Mark Rawlings, left the correlator integration/chan avg/dump times at standard 6.048,6.048,6.048 seconds for the two mosaic SBs. - Adjusted total integration times to give integer numbers of complete passes through the mosaics. For the ACA SB, it was feasible to get the required integration time in 2 rather than 3 executions: || SB || Points x Integ. x repeats ||Executions || |115_12m |14 pointings x 30.24s x 3 | 1 | |115_ACA | 5 pointings x 30.24s x 12 | 2 | - *Shifted the frequency for 92_12m from 92.000 GHz to 92.010 GHz to avoid Doppler shift that could push it below the side band edge and cause failure at the telescope.* - All 4 SBs run successfully through OSS.
2013-01-25, Mark Rawlings - version 2
- Regenerated whole project using RC5.
- Renamed SBs as per best practices.
- Modified calibrator query search radii as per current best practices.
- For 12m and ACA SBs, tweaked dump duration, channel average duration, integration duration, etc. to try to increase the likelihood that each SB execution will result in an integer number of mosaics.
- Tweaked total on-source times and SB repeat counts to try to ensure that 3x as much time is spent on the science field with the ACA (c.f. the 12-m array).
- Attempted to prep first drafts of the calibration and science TP array SBs in accordance with the TP Boot Camp slides. These should be regarded as speculative in nature, but we can try running them if we feel adventurous... Caveat emptor.
prj:ObsProject.prj:taMainComments: No major technical issues with this proposal.
prj:ObsProject.prj:consensusReport: Excellent proposal consisting in follow up of the cycle 0 observations.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Boomerang band 3
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Low band 3 continuum observations of the Boomerang Nebula

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Boomerang band 7
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band 7 continuum + CO(3-2) observations of the Boomerang Nebula

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Boomerang CO(1-0) mosaic
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band 3 CO(1-0) mosaic (+ACA) of the Boomerang Nebula
